description: Cancels a query if the query is not in a terminated state, such as CANCELLED, FAILED, TIMED_OUT, or FINISHED. You must specify an ARN value for EventDataStore. The ID of the query that you want to cancel is also required. When you run CancelQuery, the query status might show as CANCELLED even if the operation is not yet finished.

parameters.name: QueryId
parameters.description: The ID of the query that you want to cancel. The QueryId comes from the response of a StartQuery operation.

nested_items.name: QueryId
nested_items.description: The ID of the canceled query.

nested_items.name: QueryStatus
nested_items.description: Shows the status of a query after a CancelQuery request. Typically, the values shown are either RUNNING or CANCELLED.

nested_items.name: EventDataStoreOwnerAccountId
nested_items.description: The account ID of the event data store owner.
